description: First floor rear/side, two storey side extension and to replace existing conservatory with an Orangery Style extension
decision_conditions: The proposed development by reason of bulk, scale and mass of the extensions lacks subservience, overwhelms the property and would appear dominant and visually intrusive in the rear garden environment and harm the open spacing between the dwellings on the street scene contrary to policy DC61 of the London Borough of Havering Core Strategy and Development Control Policies DPD Adopted 2008, and the Residential Extensions and Alterations SPD 2011.

The proposed development would, by reason of its cumulative depth, position and close proximity to the neighbouring properties have a serious and adverse effect on the living conditions of adjacent occupiers, contrary to policy DC61 of the London Borough of Havering Core Strategy and Development Control Policies DPD Adopted 2008, and the Residential Extensions and Alterations SPD 2011.

Statement Required by Article 35 (2) of the Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015: notification of intended refusal and consideration was given to seeking amendments, which were both communicated to the agent Mr Tony Pearce via email on 21/09/21 and 29/09/21, but given conflict with adopted planning policy and no further response received, the application was determined.
